comments.author: Aisling Clinch

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Can the notes ever be null?
How will both IDs be set up in the notes?
If I have a LR=12 and LP=44 will this be like 12 44?
what happens if the ids are like 1244. Do we handle this? do we care if this happens?
Can you just a small comment for future reference how Id expected to be set up in the notes so that we can read them?
If the Ids don't follow a specific format I'm gessing we'll never get the case number.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Notes can't be null in our case...once a case (on FINEOS claims) is created then the notes is populated. The notes column has "Leave Request ID <Request ID>, Paid Leave Plan <Plan Name> with ID <Plan ID>" "what happens if the ids are like 1244." <-- this can never be the case based on the format of the notes above "Can you just a small comment for future reference how Id expected to be set up in the notes so that we can read them?" <-- sure "If the Ids don't follow a specific format I'm gessing we'll never get the case number." <-- the IDs are those on the BO (cant see them really changing?), so what ever is there is what's stored on the notes & checked against for the case number

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment:
I was having an issue where I was always getting success in the WS Payments response, for some reason the validation messages for earning records and payments preferences was not being executed. So I talked to John to help me on investigating this issue and we make 3 changes on the payload to get this working:
PeriodHistoryStatus = APPROVED CalculationPeriodProRatingRule = WORKING_DAYS Set AverageWageEarnings with some Earning Records

comments.author: Aisling Clinch

comments.author: Gil Matias
comments.comment:
generateConfigSql - Exports config data from the clean environment and generates updates a standing SQL script for importing, similar to the DDL Generation. Usage: 'gradlew generateConfigSql -PmyArgs=username,password'
if you dont run this task this kind of data is not automatically copied. that what i came to the conclusion when i was doing the other rules

Aisling Clinch

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Java code formatting is totally wrong e.g. see line 66:
message.setValue( TEMP_MESSAGE);
Why is that split over two lines?!!
Please ensure you have
1. Absence formatter imported into eclipse (window -> preferences) 2. Updated "Save actions" to always format the code, using the above formatter (window -> preferences) 3. That you have not overridden the above at project level (select project -> properties -> formatter and check save actions config). You should have "Use project specific setting" UNTICKED, for all absence project). this means that the formatting etc is configured in one place - the window -> preferences place.

Agree with Trevor after reading and article stating the advantages of using AssertThat over other assert methods.
My original review was wrong and we should keep using the AssertThat.
https://objectpartners.com/2013/09/18/the-benefits-of-using-assertthat-over-other-assert-methods-in-unit-tests/

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: why do we use this enum? In FO we have country.

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment:
Because apparently we only want to show USA and the FO has all the countries and because this was already the enum being used for the country applicable type and I assumed that those discussions already took place when the enum was added in the first place.
Because of this we need to have some mapping the rule to convert the FO:USA to Absence:USA. This is not the first time this happens in the rules and I don't want to have the same discussions over and over again. This much flexibility leads to more complexity...

comments.author: Trevor Higgins

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Any thoughts on this Rob, everthing else is done on this review...

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment:
Let's suppose in the next version of claims they change this URI but older versions remains the same, like:
new claims: /sharedpages/casemanager/main/casesearchtransparentpage/caseNumber/CASE-1000 old claims: /sharedpages/casemanager/main/casesearchtransparentpage.jsp?URLInvokedExternally=true&DetailsTab=Financials&caseNumber=CASE-1000 very old claims (hypothetical example): /oldcasesearchpage.jsp?caseNumber=CASE-1000
Considering URLs can change a lot, is it not better put the whole URL as configurable (using a placeholder for the case number) on the xml config file? Like:
http://iedev531.development.fineos.com:9416/fineos/sharedpages/casemanager/main/casesearchtransparentpage.jsp?URLInvokedExternally=true&DetailsTab=Financials&caseNumber={casenumber}

comments.author: Robert Treacy
